intro: Byrsonima nitida, commonly known as the white soursop, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, yellowish fruits with a mild, acidic flavor. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and local ecosystems.
